data.name: Adding words - Part III
data.description:
This is the third part of this kata series.

Try solving the first and second part before attempting this (or you can as well go ahead and solve this if you so wish)

Add two English words together!

Implement a class Arith such that

```javscript var k = new Arith("three"); k.add("one hundred and two point one"); //this should return "one hundred and five point one" ```

Input - Will be between zero and five billion and will always be in lower case and can be in decimal.

Output - Word representation of the result of the addition. Should be in lower case

Word format - Both input and output shall be in the format 123.19 = one hundred and twenty three point one nine. No hyphen is needed in numbers 21-99. Words should also be separated with one space and no space padding is allowed. Words after the decimal point should be spelt out one by one (e.g. 0.19 = zero point one nine not zero point nineteen)
